briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Fibrin Sealant Grifols Evaluated as an Adjunct to Hemostasis
officialTitle: A Prospective, Single-blind, Randomized, Phase II/III Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Fibrin Sealant Grifols (FS Grifols) as an Adjunct to Hemostasis During Peripheral Vascular Surgery
conditions: Target Bleeding Site During Peripheral Vascular Surgery
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and hemostasis effectiveness of human plasma-derived fibrin sealant Grifols (FS Grifols) in peripheral vascular surgery.

primaryOutcome.measure: The Primary Efficacy Endpoint is Time to Hemostasis.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: The start of treatment application at the target bleeding site (TBS) to the achievement of hemostasis at that site or to the end of the 10-minute observational period when the hemostasis has not yet been achieved.
